page.title: 07RECREATION, CONTINUED
page.content:
There is a whist drive every Wednesday night. Twice a year they have a raffle. The prizes are donated by the people nearby and in the village. Whist drives are well attended. They are held in Baumber village hall. Baumber and Hemingby used to have a weekly youth club. They had snooker, music and table tennis. It started at 7.00 and ended at 9.00. Reverend Legg started them both off. They had to close because of lack of support.
A favourite hobby is gardening. Most people in Baumber & Hemingby have a garden and that is where people spend their spare time.People grow potatoes, carrots, tomatoes,marrows & many other things.People grow their own because it is cheaper.In this block it shows that most people prefer to grow their own food.{Goto page 8.
